subject: RE: [junit] Commercial use of Junit - license issues
msgSnippet: Chris, What problems do you actually see here (or your open source office)?  JUnit is out there over six or seven years and it is integrated in all the major
messageBody:
Chris,

What problems do you actually see here (or your open source office)? JUnit is out there over six or seven years and it is integrated in all the major IDEs and used in countless commercial projects. It is hard to believe that there should be any licensing problems.

Andreas

________________________________________
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of cchaulk
Sent: Tuesday, May 30, 2006 12:00 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Commercial use of Junit - license issues

I am interested in using Junit internally (not for distribution) at my
company for some product testing. However, our open source office is
very concerned about the IBM Common Public License and its
applicability to  users and distributors of Junit and possible patent
infringements.

Can anyone comment on this concern ? If Kent or Erich are listening,
can Junit by licensed under an alternate open-source or 
commercial license ?



Chris Chaulk
